Please note that under the W3C Community Contributor License Agreement (CLA) there is a limited opt-out and other conditions apply. Learn more about W3C Community and Business Groups .

abstract.p: This proposal defines a module comprising a set of functions for actions within an user agent. It has been designed to be compatible with XQuery 3.0 and XSLT 3.0, as well as any other standard based on XPath 3.0.

status.p: Must be ignored, but is required by the schema...

div1.head: Introduction
div1.p: This proposal defines a module for providing functions dealing with actions within an user agent. It has been designed to be compatible with XQuery 3.0 and XSLT 3.0, as well as any other standard based on XPath 3.0.

div2.head: Namespace conventions
div2.p: The module defined by this document defines functions and elements in the namespace http://expath.org/ns/user-agent. In this document, the ua prefix, when used, is bound to this namespace URI.
Datatypes are defined in the namespace http://expath.org/ns/user-agent/datatype. In this document, the ua-dt prefix, when used, is bound to this namespace URI.
Error codes are defined in the namespace http://expath.org/ns/error. In this document, the err prefix, when used, is bound to this namespace URI.

div2.head: Error management
div2.p: Error conditions are identified by a code (a QName). When such an error condition is reached during the execution of the function, a dynamic error is thrown, with the corresponding error code (as if the standard XPath function error had been called).

div1.head: External variables
div1.p: These variables are available to the XQuery scripts associated with a document.

div2.head: The $ua:document variable
div2.p: This variable is bound to the document itself.

div1.head: Datatypes
div1.p: These custom datatypes are defined to be used by the module functions.

div2.head: The ua-dt:xpath-selector datatype
div2.p: This constructor functions casts the input to a custom datatype that provides XPath type selector to module functions to take as argument.
div2.eg: ua-dt:xpath-selector($arg as xs:anyAtomicType?) as ua-dt:xpath-selector?

div2.head: The ua-dt:css-selector datatype
div2.p: This constructor functions casts the input to a custom datatype that provides CSS type selector to module functions to take as argument.
div2.eg: ua-dt:css-selector($arg as xs:anyAtomicType?) as ua-dt:css-selector?

div1.head: Selectors
div1.p: Many functions in this specification use selectors for nodes as parameters. These selectors can be of two types, namely XPath selectors, and CSS selectors.
In the context of this specification, if multiple nodes are selected, then the invoking action is executed for each one of them, and if the selector selects no node, this is an error .

div2.head: The XPath selectors
div2.p: These selectors consist of valid XPath expressions, see . In order to supply XPath expressions as parameters, one has to use a constructor function, according to .

div2.head: The CSS selectors
div2.p: These selectors are valid CSS selectors, see . In order to supply CSS selectors as parameters, one has to use a constructor function, according to .

div1.head: Events
div1.p: These functions are meant to handle DOM events.

div2.head: The ua:create-event() function
div2.p: This function creates a custom event. It has two signatures: the first one takes as argument only the event type, while the initalization parameters are set to their default values, and the second consists of a map containing the initialization parameters.
div2.eg: ua:create-event($type as xs:QName) as empty()
ua:create-event($type as xs:QName, $initialization-parameters as map(xs:string, item()*)) as empty()

item.p: $type is the name of the event.
$initialization-parameters are the parameters needed for initalization of the event. For details, see
bubbles is a boolean indicating if the event bubbles up through the DOM or not. Its default value is false().
cancelable is a boolean indicating if the event is cancelable. Its default value is false().
detail is the data passed when initializing the event.

div2.head: The ua:add-event-listener() function
div2.p: This function registers an event listener.
div2.eg: ua:add-event-listener($event-target-selector as xs:anyType, $event-type as xs:string, $listener as item()) as empty()
ua:add-event-listener($event-target as xs:string, $event-type as xs:string, $listener as item(), $useCapture as xs:boolean) as empty()

item.p: $event-target-selector is the selector for the target of the event. The target may be an element, the document itself, etc. See for more details.
$event-type is the type of the event to listen for.
$listener is the handler of an action, a block of code, or a function to be executed.
$useCapture is the indication that the user wishes to initiate capture. Its default value is false().

div2.head: The ua:remove-event-listener() function
div2.p: This function removes a registered event listener.
div2.eg: ua:remove-event-listener($event-target-selector as xs:anyType, $event-type as xs:string, $listener as item()) as empty()
ua:add-event-listener($event-target-selector as xs:anyType, $event-type as xs:string, $listener as item(), $useCapture as xs:boolean) as empty()

item.p: $event-target-selector is the selector for the target of the event. The target may be an element, the document itself, etc. See for more details.
$event-type is the event type being removed.
$listener is the handler of an action, a block of code, or a function to be removed.
$useCapture is the indication that the current listener was registered as a capturing listener or not. Its default value is false().

div2.head: The ua:dispatch-event() function
div2.p: This function dispatches an event at the specified target, thus being invoked in the appropriate order the correspondent event listeners.
div2.eg: ua:dispatch-event($event-name as xs:string, $event-target-selector as xs:anyType) as empty()

item.p: $event-name is the name of event to dispatch.
$event-target-selector is the selector for the target of the event. The target may be an element, the document itself, etc. See for more details.

div1.head: Actions
div1.p: These functions define actions to be executed by direct invoking or when a certain event occurs.

div2.head: The ua:action() function
div2.p: This function defines an action to be invoked when a DOM event occurs.
div2.eg: ua:action($id as xs:ID, $parameters as map(xs:string, xs:string), $code-block as item()*) as empty()
ua:action($id as xs:ID, $event-name as xs:QName, $parameters as map(xs:string, xs:string, $code-block as item()*) as empty()

item.p: $id is the action's identificator. If the identificator is not unique within the script, this is an error .
$event-name represents the name of the event that triggers the execution of the action. If the event does not exist, this is an error .
$parameters represents the parameters passed for the execution of the action.
$code-block represents the code to be executed.

div1.head: Mutation observers
div1.p: These functions deal with Mutation observers, as they are defined in .

div2.head: The ua:observer() function
div2.p: This function creates a mutations observer. It has two signatures, one taking as second parameter a list of action handlers separated by spaces, and the other one considering as second parameter a function item.
div2.eg: ua:observer($id as xs:ID, $action-handlers as xs:IDREFS) as empty()
ua:observer($id as xs:ID, $action as function(*)) as empty()

item.p: $id is the observer's identificator. If the identificator is not unique within the script, this is an error .
$action-handlers is the list of action handlers separated by spaces, to be executed. If the action handler are not unique within the script, this is an error .
$action is the function item to be executed.

div2.head: The ua:connect-observer() function
div2.p: This function connects an observer to a node, in order to observe the node mutations.
div2.eg: ua:connect-observer($observer-handler as xs:IDREF, $node-selector as xs:string, $options as map(xs:string, xs:string)) as empty()

item.p: $observer-handler is the observer's handler. If the identificator does not exist, this is an error .
$node-selector is the selector used to select the nodes to be observed; see . If the selector selects multiple nodes, all these nodes are observed.
$options are the options describing the properties and values for observing the selected node. See for more details.

div2.head: The ua:disconnect-observer() function
div2.p: This function disconnects an observer from a node. The observer will stop observing the node until it will be connected again to the node.
div2.eg: ua:disconnect-observer($observer-handler as xs:IDREF) as empty()

item.p: $observer-handler is the observer's handler. If the identificator does not exist, this is an error .

div1.head: Templates
div1.p: These function are for handling templates.

div2.head: The ua:template() function
div2.p: This function creates a template.
div2.eg: ua:template($id as xs:ID, $content as item()*) as empty()

item.p: $id is the template's identificator. If the identificator is not unique within the script, this is an error .
$content is the content of the template.

div2.head: The ua:attach-template() function
div2.p: This function attaches a template to one or more nodes. Displaying of the attached templated depends on the value of the open attribute, as it is described in .
It is possible to attach a template when a certain event is dispatched, by using the parameter $event-name to specify the name of the respective event.
div2.eg: ua:attach-template($node-selector as xs:string, $template-id as xs:IDREF, $event-name as xs:string?) as empty()

item.p: $node-selector is the selector used to select the nodes to attache the template to; see . If the selector selects multiple nodes, the template is attached to all these nodes.
$template-id is the identificator of the template to be attached.
$event-name is the name of the event triggering the attaching of the template.

div2.head: The ua:dettach-template() function
div2.p: This function dettaches a template from one or more nodes. It has two signatures, the second one dettaching a template in case when an event is dispatched.
div2.eg: ua:dettach-template($node-selector as xs:string, $template-id as xs:IDREF) as empty()
ua:dettach-template($node-selector as xs:string, $template-id as xs:IDREF, $event-name as xs:string) as empty()

item.p: $node-selector is the selector used to select the nodes to dettache the template from; see . If the selector selects multiple nodes, the template is dettached from all these nodes.
$template-id is the identificator of the template to be dettached.
$event-name is the name of the event triggering the dettaching of the template.

div2.head: The ua:show-template() function
div2.p: This function shows a template attached to one or more nodes.
div2.eg: ua:show-template($template-id as xs:IDREF) as empty()

item.p: $template-id is the identificator of the template to be shown. If the indicated template does not exist, this is an error

div2.head: The ua:hide-template() function
div2.p: This function hides a template attached to one or more nodes.
div2.eg: ua:hide-template($template-id as xs:IDREF) as empty()

item.p: $template-id is the identificator of the template to be hidden. If the indicated template does not exist, this is an error

div2.head: The ua:get-template() function
div2.p: This function gets a template, in order to be examined, modified, etc. It returns the template as a sequence.
div2.eg: ua:get-template($template-id as xs:IDREF) as item()*

item.p: $template-id is the identificator of the template.

div2.head: The ua:update-template() function
div2.p: This function updates a template. It has two signatures, the second one updating a template in case when an event is dispatched. All the nodes having the respective template attached to them will have their view refreshened based upon the updated template.
div2.eg: ua:update-template($template-id as xs:IDREF, $new-content as item()*) as empty()
ua:update-template($template-id as xs:IDREF, $new-content as item()*, $event-name as xs:string) as empty()

item.p: $template-id is the identificator of the template to be updated.
$content is the new content of the template.
$event-name is the name of the event triggering the updating of the template.

div1.head: Scenarios of usage
div1.p: Scenarios of usage of the functions comprised by this module.

div2.head: Create an event
div2.p: This scenario presents how to create events using both signatures of the function ua:create-event(), by using default parameters or setting values to parameters.
div2.eg: ua:create-event('custom-event')
ua:create-event('custom-event', map{"bubbles" := true(), "cancelable" := true(), "detail" := ("detail-1", "detail-2")})
ua:create-event('custom-event', map{"cancelable" := true(), "detail" := ("detail-1", "detail-2")})
ua:create-event('custom-event', map{"bubbles" := true()})
ua:create-event('custom-event', map{"detail" := ("detail-1", "detail-2")})
